sen.j: 今出川 尚季（いまでがわ なおすえ、天明2年9月18日 (旧暦)（1782年10月24日） - 文化 (元号)7年8月29日 (旧暦)（1810年9月27日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Naosue IMADEGAWA (born on October 24, 1782 and died on September 27, 1810) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the late Edo period.
Naosue IMADEGAWA (October 24, 1782 - September 27, 1810) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「born on & died on」を削除しました。
sen.e: Naosue IMADEGAWA (October 24, 1782 - September 27, 1810) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 主に光格天皇（119代）の代の朝廷に仕え、官位は正二位権大納言まで昇った。
sen.e: He mainly served the Emperor Kokaku (119th) in the Imperial Court and rose to the official rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Dainagon (a chief councilor of state).
He mainly served the Emperor Kokaku (119th) in the Imperial Court and rose to the official rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 原文の「大納言」を、ウィキに合わせて「権大納言」に修正し、訳も修正しました。
sen.e: He mainly served the Emperor Kokaku (119th) in the Imperial Court and rose to the official rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 父は内大臣今出川実種。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (the minister of the Interior), Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
His father was Naidaijin (the minister of the Interior), Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
His father was Naidaijin (the minister of the Interior), Sanetane IMADEGAWA.

sen.j: 母は水戸藩主徳川宗翰の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of the lord of the Mito Domain, Munemoto TOKUGAWA.
His mother was a daughter of the lord of the Mito Domain, Munemoto TOKUGAWA.
His mother was a daughter of the lord of the Mito Domain, Munemoto TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 室は関白鷹司輔平（閑院宮直仁親王王子）の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Kanpaku (a chief adviser to the Emperor), Sukehira TAKATSUKASA (the Prince of the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito).
His wife was a daughter of Kanpaku (a chief adviser to the Emperor), Sukehira TAKATSUKASA (the Prince of the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito).
His wife was a daughter of Kanpaku (a chief adviser to the Emperor), Sukehira TAKATSUKASA (the Prince of the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito).

sen.j: 子息に権中納言今出川公久、左近衛中将小倉随季（小倉豊季養子）がいる。
sen.e: Chunagon (a vice-councilor of state), Kimihisa IMADEGAWA and Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Michisue Ogura (an adopted son of Toyosue Ogura) were his sons.

Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), Kimihisa IMADEGAWA and Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Michisue Ogura (an adopted son of Toyosue Ogura) were his sons.
sen.cmt: ウィキに合わせて、原文を以下のように修正し、訳も修正しました。「中納言」→「権中納言」「近衛府」→「左近衛中将」
sen.e: Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), Kimihisa IMADEGAWA and Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Michisue Ogura (an adopted son of Toyosue Ogura) were his sons.
The peerage was conferred on him in 1783.
The peerage was conferred on him in 1783.
The peerage was conferred on him in 1783.

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として早いスピードで出世し、侍従・左近衛少将を経て、寛政4年（1792年）に従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: Since then, he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Sakonoe no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of the Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1792, he received the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BB%8A%E5%87%BA%E5%B7%9D%E5%B0%9A%E5%AD%A3 より 「侍従・近衛府を経て」→「侍従・左近衛権少将を経て」に変更しました。
sen.e: Since then, he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Sakonoe no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of the Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1792, he received the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.

Since then, he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Sakonoe no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of the Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1792, he received the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.

sen.j: 左近衛中将・権中納言・踏歌節会外弁を経て、文化2年（1805年）に権大納言・大歌所別当に就任した。
sen.e: In 1805, he assumed Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state), Outadokoro betto (an official in charge of managing and providing training for ancient Japanese songs and instruments) after taking various positions such as Sakonoe no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of the Inner Palace Guards), Gon chunagon and Toka no sechie Geben (an official in charge of organizing and supervising ceremonies in the Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BB%8A%E5%87%BA%E5%B7%9D%E5%B0%9A%E5%AD%A3 より 「近衛府・中納言・踏歌節会外弁を経て、文化2年（1805年）に大納言」→「右近衛中将・権中納言・踏歌節会外弁を経て、文化2年（1805年）に権大納言」に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1805, he assumed Gon Dainagon, Outadokoro betto (an official in charge of managing and providing training for ancient Japanese songs and instruments) after taking various positions such as Sakonoe no chujo, Gon chunagon and Toka no sechie Geben (an official in charge of organizing and supervising ceremonies in the Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: 「権大納言」「左近衛中将」は前に出てきているので、説明文を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1805, he assumed Gon Dainagon, Outadokoro betto (an official in charge of managing and providing training for ancient Japanese songs and instruments) after taking various positions such as Sakonoe no chujo, Gon chunagon and Toka no sechie Geben (an official in charge of organizing and supervising ceremonies in the Imperial Court).

sen.j: 翌年に大歌所別当は辞し、さらに文化7年（1810年）には権大納言も辞した。
sen.e: In 1806, he resigned from Outadokoro betto and in 1810, he also resigned from Gon Dainagon.
In 1806, he resigned from Outadokoro betto and in 1810, he also resigned from Gon Dainagon.
In 1806, he resigned from Outadokoro betto and in 1810, he also resigned from Gon Dainagon.
In 1810, he died.
In 1810, he died.
In 1810, he died.
Died at 29.
He died at the age of 29.
sen.cmt: 「at the age of」を追記しました。
sen.e: He died at the age of 29.
